title: Spain says backs 'peaceful', 'stable' solution for Syria
content: Spain's Foreign Minister, Jose Manuel Albares, expressed hope for a peaceful transition in Syria following reports of President Bashar al-Assad's departure and the fall of Damascus to rebels. Albares emphasized the importance of Syrian self-determination, territorial integrity, and regional stability. He confirmed the safety of the small Spanish community in Syria amid the rapidly unfolding events.
summary: Spain's Foreign Minister, Jose Manuel Albares, expressed hope for a peaceful transition in Syria following reports of President Bashar al-Assad's departure and the fall of Damascus to rebels.  Albares emphasized the importance of Syrian self-determination, territorial integrity, and regional stability. He confirmed the safety of the small Spanish community in Syria amid the rapidly unfolding events.

title: Melbourne synagogue fire an act of 'terrorism': Australian PM
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese condemned a Melbourne synagogue fire as "terrorism" and highlighted rising anti-Semitism. Arsonists gutted the Adass Israel Synagogue, prompting a police investigation. The attack drew international condemnation, with some criticizing the Australian government's stance on anti-Semitism and its recent UN vote concerning Israel.
summary: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese condemned a Melbourne synagogue fire as "terrorism" and highlighted rising anti-Semitism.  Arsonists gutted the Adass Israel Synagogue, prompting a police investigation.  The attack drew international condemnation, with some criticizing the Australian government's stance on anti-Semitism and its recent UN vote concerning Israel.

title: NYPD releases fresh photographs of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's alleged assassin
content: Police released new images of the masked suspect in the targeted killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, including one from inside a taxi. The suspect, who traveled from Atlanta, shot Thompson three times outside a Midtown hotel before fleeing to Central Park, discarding a backpack containing a jacket and Monopoly money.
summary: Police released new images of the masked suspect in the targeted killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, including one from inside a taxi. The suspect, who traveled from Atlanta, shot Thompson three times outside a Midtown hotel before fleeing to Central Park, discarding a backpack containing a jacket and Monopoly money.

title: Meet the Assads: How rebel forces toppled Syria’s decades-long dynasty
content: After over five decades of Assad family rule, President Bashar al-Assad has fled Damascus as rebel forces breach the Syrian capital. The Alawite dynasty, established by Hafez al-Assad in 1970, maintained power through strategic manipulation of sectarian divisions. Bashar, inheriting power in 2000, failed to implement reforms, leading to the 2011 uprising and subsequent civil war.
summary: After over five decades of Assad family rule, President Bashar al-Assad has fled Damascus as rebel forces breach the Syrian capital. The Alawite dynasty, established by Hafez al-Assad in 1970, maintained power through strategic manipulation of sectarian divisions. Bashar, inheriting power in 2000, failed to implement reforms, leading to the 2011 uprising and subsequent civil war.

title: Mohammed Al-Jolani: The rebel leader who toppled Assad’s rule in Syria
content: Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, leader of Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), led a rebel offensive that claims to have ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad. Jolani, formerly linked to Al-Qaeda, has presented a more moderate image recently. The offensive swiftly captured key cities, culminating in rebels entering Damascus.
summary: Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, leader of Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), led a rebel offensive that claims to have ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad. Jolani, formerly linked to Al-Qaeda, has presented a more moderate image recently. The offensive swiftly captured key cities, culminating in rebels entering Damascus.

title: US President-elect Trump meets 'good man' Prince William at Notre-Dame reopening
content: Former US President Donald Trump and Prince William met at the reopening of Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris. They spoke briefly at the ceremony and later met for 40 minutes. Trump praised William, calling him a "good man" doing a "fantastic job," eliciting laughter from the prince.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump and Prince William met at the reopening of Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris. They spoke briefly at the ceremony and later met for 40 minutes. Trump praised William, calling him a "good man" doing a "fantastic job," eliciting laughter from the prince.

title: 'We die a thousand times every day': Hamas releases video of Israeli hostage amid rising calls for ceasefire negotiations
content: Hamas released a video of Israeli hostage Matan Zangauker pleading for a ceasefire after over 420 days in captivity. He described dire conditions and urged the Israeli government to negotiate the hostages' release. Zangauker's mother and advocacy groups echoed his plea, criticizing Prime Minister Netanyahu's alleged inaction while ceasefire talks show renewed potential progress.
summary: Hamas released a video of Israeli hostage Matan Zangauker pleading for a ceasefire after over 420 days in captivity.  He described dire conditions and urged the Israeli government to negotiate the hostages' release.  Zangauker's mother and advocacy groups echoed his plea, criticizing Prime Minister Netanyahu's alleged inaction while ceasefire talks show renewed potential progress.

title: Mysterious UFO-like drones brighten up skies, leaving residents bewildered and concerned
content: Mysterious drones have been spotted flying over New Jersey for weeks, sparking curiosity and concern among residents. Seen near critical infrastructure and residential areas, these large drones have even interfered with a medical helicopter rescue. While officials claim no public danger, the operators and purpose remain unknown, prompting an FBI investigation and official monitoring.
summary: Mysterious drones have been spotted flying over New Jersey for weeks, sparking curiosity and concern among residents.  Seen near critical infrastructure and residential areas, these large drones have even interfered with a medical helicopter rescue.  While officials claim no public danger, the operators and purpose remain unknown, prompting an FBI investigation and official monitoring.

title: Where is Syrian President Assad? Questions mount as rebels close in on Damascus
content: Amid a sweeping rebel offensive, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's whereabouts are unknown, with unverified reports suggesting he fled Damascus. Rebels have seized key cities, leaving Assad's regime clinging to a few strongholds. Even allies like Hezbollah and Iran are reportedly reducing their support, as the conflict intensifies and Assad's grip on power weakens.
summary: Amid a sweeping rebel offensive, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's whereabouts are unknown, with unverified reports suggesting he fled Damascus.  Rebels have seized key cities, leaving Assad's regime clinging to a few strongholds.  Even allies like Hezbollah and Iran are reportedly reducing their support, as the conflict intensifies and Assad's grip on power weakens.

title: US extends $1 billion in military support to Ukraine ahead of Trump inauguration
content: The US is bolstering Ukraine's defense with an additional $1 billion in long-term military aid, including drones and HIMARS munitions. This comes as the Biden administration expedites spending of approved funds before the presidential transition. A separate $725 million package was announced earlier this week.
summary: The US is bolstering Ukraine's defense with an additional $1 billion in long-term military aid, including drones and HIMARS munitions. This comes as the Biden administration expedites spending of approved funds before the presidential transition. A separate $725 million package was announced earlier this week.

title: 'Militarily, Damascus has fallen': Syrian rebels breach Assad defenses to enter capital; top developments
content: Syrian rebels seize Homs and advance on Damascus, jeopardizing Assad's rule. HTS, a designated terrorist group, leads the offensive as Hezbollah withdraws forces. Intense gunfire erupts in Damascus amid celebrations in Homs. International diplomacy calls for an end to hostilities and a political solution.
summary: Syrian rebels seize Homs and advance on Damascus, jeopardizing Assad's rule.  HTS, a designated terrorist group, leads the offensive as Hezbollah withdraws forces. Intense gunfire erupts in Damascus amid celebrations in Homs. International diplomacy calls for an end to hostilities and a political solution.

title: 'Buy a suit Zelenskyy': Ukrainian president greets Trump in casual sweatshirt and boots
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's casual attire during meetings with US President-elect Donald Trump and French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris sparked online debate. While some criticized his choice of clothing, others, including Senator John Fetterman, expressed support.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's casual attire during meetings with US President-elect Donald Trump and French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris sparked online debate. While some criticized his choice of clothing, others, including Senator John Fetterman, expressed support.

title: Brian Thompson murder case: NYPD divers search lake for murder weapon as manhunt enters fourth day
content: NYPD divers searched Central Park's lake for the murder weapon used in the assassination of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. A backpack belonging to the suspect was found, but the weapon and electric bicycle remain missing. Investigators believe the suspect, who arrived from Atlanta, has fled the city by bus. A $60,000 reward is offered for information leading to an arrest.
summary: NYPD divers searched Central Park's lake for the murder weapon used in the assassination of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.  A backpack belonging to the suspect was found, but the weapon and electric bicycle remain missing.  Investigators believe the suspect, who arrived from Atlanta, has fled the city by bus. A $60,000 reward is offered for information leading to an arrest.

title: South Korea arrests ex-defense minister Kim Yong-Hyun in treason charges over martial law
content: South Korea's former defense minister, Kim Yong-hyun, was arrested Sunday for his alleged role in President Yoon Suk Yeol's short-lived martial law declaration. Kim, who resigned Wednesday, reportedly suggested the measure to Yoon. Despite surviving an impeachment vote, Yoon faces pressure to resign. Prosecutors and national police are investigating treason allegations against Yoon, Kim, and other officials.
summary: South Korea's former defense minister, Kim Yong-hyun, was arrested Sunday for his alleged role in President Yoon Suk Yeol's short-lived martial law declaration.  Kim, who resigned Wednesday, reportedly suggested the measure to Yoon.  Despite surviving an impeachment vote, Yoon faces pressure to resign.  Prosecutors and national police are investigating treason allegations against Yoon, Kim, and other officials.

title: Bangladesh diplomats to return after talks on December 9
content: Following attacks on Bangladesh's diplomatic missions in India and alleged desecration of its flag, two Bangladeshi diplomats are set to return to their posts after foreign secretary-level talks between the two countries. Tensions escalated after reports of minority persecution in Bangladesh following the July uprising.
summary: Following attacks on Bangladesh's diplomatic missions in India and alleged desecration of its flag, two Bangladeshi diplomats are set to return to their posts after foreign secretary-level talks between the two countries. Tensions escalated after reports of minority persecution in Bangladesh following the July uprising.

title: German far-right AfD leader is Chinese-speaking lesbian economist
content: Alice Weidel, the chancellor candidate for Germany's far-right AfD party, presents a unique profile. A lesbian raising a family with a Sri Lankan-born partner, Weidel's background contrasts with the party's traditional image. Analysts suggest this makes her an asset, broadening the AfD's appeal, while critics label her an opportunist.
summary: Alice Weidel, the chancellor candidate for Germany's far-right AfD party, presents a unique profile. A lesbian raising a family with a Sri Lankan-born partner, Weidel's background contrasts with the party's traditional image. Analysts suggest this makes her an asset, broadening the AfD's appeal, while critics label her an opportunist.

title: Saudi royal slams 'genocidal' Israel, welcomes Trump
content: A senior Saudi royal termed Israel "genocidal" and an "apartheid" state on Saturday, as he called on incoming US President-elect Donald Trump to bring peace to the Middle East. "Friendly countries in the region are hoping that Mr. Trump pursues what he started before, to bring peace with capital letters to the Middle East," he said.
summary: A senior Saudi royal termed Israel "genocidal" and an "apartheid" state on Saturday, as he called on incoming US President-elect Donald Trump to bring peace to the Middle East. "Friendly countries in the region are hoping that Mr. Trump pursues what he started before, to bring peace with capital letters to the Middle East," he said.

title: Trillion-dollar gap in Taiwan, Korea stock fortunes
content: Taiwan's stock market surges amidst the global AI boom, outpacing South Korea's struggling market. Taiwan's dominance in the semiconductor industry, particularly TSMC's success, fuels this growth. Meanwhile, South Korea grapples with political instability and Samsung's underperformance. Despite looming US tariff threats, Taiwan appears better positioned due to its crucial role in US tech supply chains.
summary: Taiwan's stock market surges amidst the global AI boom, outpacing South Korea's struggling market.  Taiwan's dominance in the semiconductor industry, particularly TSMC's success, fuels this growth. Meanwhile, South Korea grapples with political instability and Samsung's underperformance.  Despite looming US tariff threats, Taiwan appears better positioned due to its crucial role in US tech supply chains.

title: CEO's shooting lays bare US' health cover woes
Hawk Tuah girl's attorney says she didn't intend to fleece fans after crypto crash
content: ​Crypto investigator Stephen Findeisen revealed that Hailey Welch was paid $125,000 in advance for marketing the token from an unspecified company, and was to receive 50 per cent of net proceeds from that company after third-party expenses and costs for the development and launch had been covered. Hailey Welch's attorney said she didn't intend to fleece fans.
summary: ​Crypto investigator Stephen Findeisen revealed that Hailey Welch was paid $125,000 in advance for marketing the token from an unspecified company, and was to receive 50 per cent of net proceeds from that company after third-party expenses and costs for the development and launch had been covered.  Hailey Welch's attorney said she didn't intend to fleece fans.
